desc.simpara: GtkHBox is a box container that packs child widgets in a single row, using the packing methods inherited from GtkBox. GtkHBox and GtkVBox in combination are the most commonly used packing widgets. See GtkVBox for a working example.

Note that all children in a GtkHBox are allocated the same height, regardless of settings and child requisition size. Widgets taking up less than the allocated height are by default centered within the available area in that dimension.
See also: GtkContainer, GtkBox, GtkVBox, GtkButtonBox, GtkLayout, GtkTable.

constructor.shortdesc: Creates a container for a single row of child widgets.

desc.simpara: Creates a new horizontal box container designed for packing a single row of child widgets.
